meanings.definition: A person who lacks skill or ability in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: The new employee was a jacklegs in the kitchen, often burning the food.
meanings.sent2: The team had to replace the jacklegs with a skilled chef to improve the restaurant's quality.
meanings.sent3: The jacklegs cook mistook salt for sugar, creating a salty cake.
meanings.sent4: His attempt at fixing the car was that of a jacklegs trying brain surgery.
meanings.sent5: The jacklegs painter left the walls streaked with paint, showing his lack of expertise.

meanings.definition: To work or operate in a makeshift or unprofessional manner.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic had to jacklegs the broken engine temporarily until the parts arrived.
meanings.sent2: She had to jacklegs her way through the presentation after forgetting her notes.
meanings.sent3: He tried to jacklegs a solution together using duct tape and glue.
meanings.sent4: The team had to jacklegs the project due to unexpected delays.
meanings.sent5: The students had to jacklegs their science experiment with household items.
